text: Hamadryas argentea (also called Silvery Buttercup) is a species of plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is endemic to Falkland Islands. Its natural habitats are temperate dwarf shrub heath and temperate grassland. ==Sources== * Broughton, D.A. & McAdam, J.H. 2003. Hamadryas argentea. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 21 August 2007. Category:Ranunculaceae Category:Flora of the Falkland Islands Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Hamadryas argentea
